comments.body:
You need the dll because it is a shared build, but it is not getting installed, try the following patch

``` diff
diff --git a/CMakeLists.txt b/CMakeLists.txt
index 3c90f5d..01bdc72 100644
--- a/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt
@@ -128,4 +128,5 @@ set(RE2_HEADERS
     )

 install(FILES ${RE2_HEADERS} DESTINATION include/re2)
-install(TARGETS re2 ARCHIVE DESTINATION lib LIBRARY DESTINATION lib)
+install(TARGETS re2 ARCHIVE DESTINATION lib LIBRARY DESTINATION lib
+                    RUNTIME DESTINATION bin)
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@    - test -f ${PREFIX}/include/re2/re2.h  # [unix]
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\include\\re2\\re2.h exit 1  # [win]
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\lib\\re2.lib exit 1  # [win]
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\bin\\re2.dll exit 1  # [win]

comments.body: Please raise an issue and/or open a PR upstream explaining the problem and the need for this sort of change.

Apparently missed this. ðŸ˜”

It is causing all builds to be skipped in the feedstock. Please remove this `skip` and re-render in a fresh PR from your fork.

Happy to do this @jakirkham! But I don't understand how this is the trigger.  I see that no artefacts are being collected...  https://ci.appveyor.com/project/conda-forge/staged-recipes/build/1.0.8952/job/den9lm6ivvne8em4
Issue is that builds are skipped when python!=3.5, but there is no python in build requirements, so conda-smithy will not generate ci yaml files.
But `conda build` clearly runs and builds the package.  What am I missing?
`conda build` runs it on this repo. Issue is that conda-smithy thinks you are skipping the build.
Oh OK.  I guess I don't really understand how conda-smithy works then.  The whole VC system interacting with python versions seems strange, though.
Yes, but that's a different issue though.

So `conda-build-all` is used in `staged-recipes` and it runs using [matrix conditions](https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/blob/fa6d6c913cc49982cd39d9601162315f88e144ce/appveyor.yml#L99) that effectively force a range of `python` versions to be tried anyways.

While the feedstocks have the same [matrix conditions](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/4f10b7d47b08b9e98b216be2d31bfe3d14673fb7/conda_smithy/configure_feedstock.py#L405) used by `conda-build-all` to inform `conda-smithy`, they are used to determine what [actually cases](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/4f10b7d47b08b9e98b216be2d31bfe3d14673fb7/conda_smithy/configure_feedstock.py#L279-L280) will really be built for to [fill out the template](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/4f10b7d47b08b9e98b216be2d31bfe3d14673fb7/conda_smithy/configure_feedstock.py#L322-L324). As there never was a Python 3.5 case, we find the CI is [dropped](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/4f10b7d47b08b9e98b216be2d31bfe3d14673fb7/conda_smithy/configure_feedstock.py#L289-L293).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [not py35]
  detect_binary_files_with_prefix: True
